title: Ocmulgee National Monument: Volunteer
body: Volunteer            Ocmulgee National Monument needs volunteers during special events throughout the year. Volunteers are need in September during our Indian Celebration. The event brings in 12,000 visitors over a two day period and volunteers are need in many areas during this event. In March during the Cherry Blossom Festival the park has its Lantern Light Tours. Volunteers are need during the evening event with set up and taking down of the 300 luminaries in the park. In April during our Earth day event the park needs help with handing out trees to visitors and assisting with different educational booths. Volunteers are always needed to help assist with litter pick up along the park's 5 1/2 miles of trails.  For more information please contact the volunteer coordinator. Ocmulgee National Monument  1207 Emery Hwy.  Macon GA 31217 (478) 752-8257 EXT 219
